_source.title: Analgesia - mild-to-moderate pain: Scenario: Paracetamol

title: Analgesia - mild-to-moderate pain: Scenario: Paracetamol
content: Scenario: <mark>Paracetamol</mark> From age 3 months onwards. What are the contraindications and cautions for <mark>paracetamol</mark>? There are no contraindications to the use
use of <mark>paracetamol.</mark> Prescribe <mark>paracetamol</mark> with caution (and consider a dose reduction ): If there are risk factors for hepatotoxicity and inadvertent paracetamol
<mark>paracetamol</mark> overdose, including:Alcohol dependency. Malnutrition. Chronic dehydration. Body weight less than 50 kg. Severe liver disease â  pharmacokinetics
pharmacokinetics of <mark>paracetamol</mark> is altered in severe liver disease, and the hazards of overdose are greater in people  with non-cirrhotic alcoholic liver disease
disease. Increasing age and/or frailty  â a reduction of the clearance of <mark>paracetamol</mark> has been associated with increased age and frailty. In addition, elderly
